title: Trauma Care Amendments Act of 1993
content: Trauma Care Amendments Act of 1993 - Amends the Public Health Service Act to: (1) increase the number of members of the Advisory Council on Trauma Care Systems. (2) include on the Council an individual who has been a trauma patient at a designated trauma center, to be appointed for a four-year term. And (3) require that at least four of the members be knowledgeable concerning rural areas. Requires the Council to meet not less than once and, if the Chair determines necessary, up to four times each year . Includes among requirements for State plans coordination and cooperation among bordering States with respect to areas in which logical geographic groupings across State borders would be appropriate . Authorizes appropriations. Directs the General Accounting Office to study and report to the appropriate congressional committees on the duplication of Federal emergency medical services and trauma activities.
